title: This board needs stricter ruling in terms of what kind of content's allowed
body:
I'm sick and tired of all those Lee/Yasuo/Insertanyotherpopularchampionhere hate threads clogging this section and flooding hot, drowning out any kind of actual discussion or gameplay related topics.

Mindless hate mongering and complaining shouldn't be acceptable.

replies.body:
Jesus fucking christ guys. The issue is not that people are making Yasuo threads. or ''not Mordekaiser threads''

The issue is that these threads are purely just spreading hate. Not pointing out actual issues or offering solutions. They're just useless negativity.

Thought I'd clear that up for those who didn't get the memo.

Exactly. 
"I think Yasuo is too strong and here are some nerfs for him" is fine. 
"Upvote if you hate Yasuo mains" is not fine.
It also gets old very fast.

This is why I like you, Rubrick, Malicious, and Ralanr.

EDIT: You too Big Lincoln

While I like the overall point of this post, just remember that people need some way to vent their frustrations. 

If they can't do it here they will find other avenues. Some of which could be worse than a relatively harmless post here in gameplay.
Well, they can go into General Discussion. Gameplay should be a sub-board with actual discussion about the game happening.

it's

which are 2 different things

But replace the word "Yasuo" with the name of literally any other champion in the game and suddenly it's a hate speech post that gets -10 downvotes.

It's about gameplay, but this thread itself isn't meant for gameplay.

Sucks when you have to ask to fix a rule but the way you have to ask for the rule to be fixed kinda also violates the rule. Lmao. Silly board is silly nah?

It's not the problem of them expressing their opinion, that's fine. It's the problem of them becoming practically 5 word posts of,"*Insert champ name here* too op, plz nerf." It doesn't offer anything constructive or substantial, which is what Gameplay should be used for, and people upvote anyway.
i'm a mage main, and i don't hate yasuo

I recommend we make posts that do not promote healthy discussion locked or just moved to General Discussion. Like, mods should be allowed to do that. These posts are useless for players as a whole and makes it more like a popularity contest than an actual sub-Board talking about ACTUAL gameplay issues.

So instead of this:
"Omfg what the hell is Yasuo's damage, nerf this already rito"

We get this:
"Yasuo's early game damage could use a nerf, particularly his Q"

Because I'll be damned if people try to start actual discussions and get drowned out by mindless QQ. Yes, we get it, you hate Yasuo or whoever. Now stop complaining and talk about balance rather than your feelings like this is Dr. Phil or something.
I'm tired of posts saying that they're tired of ban yasuo/lee sin threads.

fact that you're being downvoted just shows how this place is full of children in their mind

anyway yasuo win rate dropped to 49.9%

he won't be nerfed again, so worry not MM riot won't listen to them

He's probably getting some downvotes because what he's done is hypocritical. It's in the wrong sub-forum and is hating on posts that hate on stuff.

I agree with the idea but we can't act like op is completely in the right here.
big lincoln posts should be stickied tbh
Now now, let's not swell his head.

To be fair you guys all do this to yourselves. You just post an opinion about something and then you all bandwagon it and its this one giant circle jerk on why X champion needs nerfs or that they should be removed from the game (which will nevere actually happen). There is no talk of what should be nerfed to fix the current state of the champion, just "OMG fuck Yasuo such bullshit champ amirite fam?" threads.

So my suggestion is that opinion based threads need to be accompanied by legitimate and well thought-out fixes to the current situation of the game. You want Yasuo nerfed? What about him should be nerfed? You hate the newest rework of Sejuani? What about the new rework makes you desire the old incarnation of Sejuani? You hate an item change and how would you change the item to make it better for the game? These types of threads facilitate discussion as opposed to mindless banter and complaining.
I'm really sick of people complaining about people complaining. If there was good forum moderation, this thread would have been deleted.
We don't need more censorship, especially not because of something as trivial as shit-posts and vents.
"Censorship", lulz... I call that "curation". And no one said you shoudln't shit-post at all. Just not on the "Gameplay" sub-board.

> [{quoted}](name=DeathBurs7,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfr7QBQY,comment-id=00080000,timestamp=2017-06-02T14:58:34.223+0000)
>
> "Censorship", lulz... I call that "curation". And no one said you shoudln't shit-post at all. Just not on the "Gameplay" sub-board.

That's wrong. Curation is only applicable if you have stock to manage, to ensure its quality on the market. The forum does not make nor own the opinion of its forum-goers. There is nothing to curate. There is only filtering, general management and censorship.

Filtering and management shouldn't come to delete stuff because you find them annoying, that would be censorship. The only exception is when someone breaks the rule. Having a hatred towards a champ or 2 itself does not break the rules.

The main thing I see being an issue is people putting "Petition" in their title. 
1. It's not an actual petition
2. Riot doesn't care if it gets over 100 upvotes
3. The boards will upvote anything in favor of the circlejerk that's around at the time.

>Mindless hate mongering and complaining shouldn't be acceptable.

Just remember that one person's 'mindless hate mongering and complaining' is another person's well justified communication to Riot to fix something. I know it sounds good to ask people to at least suggest solutions but most people are not capable of offering useful solutions and yet their complaints are still valid. It sucks to hear "Yasuo is massively unfun to play against" a hundred times with nothing further added, but that doesn't make it any less true.

All that said... yeah some threads should probably still not be there because their tone is problematic enough. It's fine to bitch about Yasuo, it's not fine to be a jerk while doing so.
It needs more cowbell
Circlejerks, and anti-circlejerks circle jerks. Both are problems, and you're part of one.

I hope that the moderators that Riot will bring on to this project can help with this issue. I agree that it's something that needs to be addressed.

I think Gameplay would benefit from aggressive moderation that just deleted threads with those kinds of "mindless" threads. The danger is that it would be perceived as "censoring" a dissenting opinion. I understand why they aren't doing that already, and I think a more creative solution might be necessary to really fix the problem.
